image.altText: A view of the Whyalla steelworks taken at sunset

props.synopsis: South Australia's energy minister has travelled to Italy to "eyeball" the firm tasked with developing a $500 million furnace for the Whyalla steelworks, as the owners of the plant reveal the project is at least a year behind schedule.

title.children: Further delays forecast as owners say Whyalla steelworks project at least a year behind schedule

image.altText: Skyscrapers are seen against a cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: On the southern border of the US, the Texas governor has taken drastic steps to keep migrants out of the country, and to reshape the political debate inside it.

title.children: 'This issue will destroy New York': After Texas sent buses to the city, its politics started to shift

image.altText: Cyber hacking

props.synopsis: The organisation is yet to be named, according to National Cyber Security Coordinator Michelle McGuinness, who says the Australian Federal Police is looking into the breach.

title.children: Government investigating 'large-scale ransomware' data breach of commercial health organisation

image.altText: A man wearing dark glasses leans over and smells a handful of grain.

props.synopsis: Breweries are increasingly turning to unusual and sustainable products and production methods to stand out in a competitive market.

title.children: Boutique brewer launches beer made with camel dung

image.altText: A woman and dog.

props.synopsis: Greta bus crash victim's mother says a plea deal offered to the driver 'has torn apart any progress that we've made recovering from this nightmare'.

title.children: Grieving mother loses 'trust in justice' after daughter's body kept on a crashed bus for two days

image.altText: Shoppers walk through Pitt Street Mall

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate rises to 4.1 per cent in April, up from 3.9 per cent in March, after unemployment increased by 30,300 people.

title.children: Australia's unemployment rate rises to 4.1 per cent in April

image.altText: Bowen looks to an out-of-focus King, a number of people are visible behind him.

props.synopsis: Car makers will be forced to reduce their emissions for new vehicles as the federal government strikes a deal with the Greens to pass its climate laws for the industry.

title.children: Government strikes deal with Greens to pass emissions laws for new vehicles

image.altText: 2024-25 Federal Budget papers

props.synopsis: Financially vulnerable Australians stand to miss out on the full value of the budget's $300 energy bill relief, because the policy will slash the indexation of their welfare payments.

title.children: Energy support backfires with welfare recipients to end up with less than $300

image.altText: Mandarins loose on a kitchen counter next to mandarins packed in a Coles-branded brown recyclable paper bag with a net window.

props.synopsis: Small and big retailers alike are looking to adopt new recyclable packaging for mandarins, saying it would avoid the use of 11,700 kilograms of plastic in one year.

title.children: Paper bags make a comeback for fruit as retailers swap out plastic net bags to reduce waste

image.altText: A screenshot of an instagram post, feature a shirtless man and text reading bulking lunch box for students

props.synopsis: A new wave of fitness and gym influencers is exposing young boys to a constant barrage of pursuits for physical perfection, and experts warn it poses a serious mental health risk.

title.children: 'We need to be really concerned': How fitness influencers are creating 'a false sense of the world' for young boys

image.altText: A man wearing jeans is held on the ground by police and bystanders

props.synopsis: Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico has been shot after a government meeting in the city of Handlova. An official has described the 59-year-old's condition as "life-threatening".

title.children: Slovakia PM shot in 'politically motivated' attack, remains in life-threatening condition, 71yo arrested

image.altText: A tall man holding a basketball.

props.synopsis: The former Australian Olympic basketballer has been found guilty on one count of bodily harm for punching a woman in the head eight times.

title.children: Former NBL player Danny Morseu found guilty of punching woman

image.altText: A man speaking, with bright lights visible near him

props.synopsis: All but the most keen political buffs abroad will be hearing the name Robert Fico for the first time right now, and for all the wrong reasons.

title.children: Assassination attempt on 'polarising' leader Robert Fico came after years of controversy

image.altText: Marathon runner Liam Adams, wearing green and gold, crosses the finish line.

props.synopsis: Australian marathon runner Liam Adams has said he "was in complete shock" when he discovered he had not qualified for this year's Paris Olympic Games.

title.children: Adams 'in complete shock' after learning he did not qualify for Olympics despite world ranking

image.altText: A woman wearing a red checkered keffiyeh cries while supported by a crowd of mourners.

props.synopsis: One man has been killed by Israeli troops and another has been injured as Palestinians gathered to commemorate "Nakba Day" in the West Bank.

title.children: One man killed in clash with Israeli troops during 'Nakba Day' commemorations in the West Bank

image.altText: Part of the steel bridge span is smashed on top of a loaded cargo ship.

props.synopsis: The Dali ship suffered four blackouts in the hours before it crashed into Baltimore's Key Bridge, though three of them are yet to be explained. Here's what we know about the problems that unfolded before the disaster.

title.children: Crew trapped on Baltimore ship as investigation continues into power blackouts that caused bridge collapse

image.altText: Nataasha Torzsa smiles while sitting in front of garden. She's wearing a colourful floral dress.

props.synopsis: Budgeting is not just about restricting your spending. It's a tool to help you better manage your money and achieve your financial goals, writes Nataasha Torzsa.

title.children: I saved $50k as a single mum using this budgeting method

image.altText: a student studing on her laptop, and writing notes, at a library desk

props.synopsis: There are more than 1,000 teaching vacancies across regional NSW. At Merriwa Central School in the NSW Upper Hunter there are six vacancies and a recent recruitment drive only attracting two applicants.

title.children: A $20k sign-on bonus hasn't been enough to get teachers to Kaylee's school. She's worried she may fail Year 12

image.altText: A close-up of a person looking at their mobile phone

props.synopsis: Mental health groups say the government did not go far enough in its commitment to create a digital platform for people with simpler mental health needs, and funding for more workers was more urgently needed.

title.children: Online counselling platform won't be an app — and mental health groups say it also won't be enough

image.altText: A large classical sandstone building with columns

props.synopsis: A former couple charged with numerous child exploitation and sexual abuse offences will have 27 charges withdrawn, while more than 60 other charges remain against the pair.

title.children: Foster parents who allegedly sexually abused children facing more than 60 charges

image.altText: A woman sits at an outdoor table in the outback with sheets of papers in front of her and a hill in the background..

props.synopsis: Journalist Alex Barwick has lived in Alice Springs for 16 years but she's only recently dared to investigate Pine Gap, the ultra-secretive US spy base in her own backyard.

title.children: Everyone has an opinion about Pine Gap, but no-one wants to talk about it

image.altText: A crowd of people walking in a city with high rise buildings in the background on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading higher after the latest jobs data showed the unemployment rate ticked up to 4.1 per cent in April — more than economists had expected. Follow live.

title.children: Economists say jobs data is proof that labour market is weakening as RBA 'desires', local shares surge

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Major health organisation hit by 'large-scale ransomware' attack
Employment growth keeping pace with population growth, ABS says
'Remarkable' that new jobs are being created while jobless rate rises, Chalmers says

image.altText: a group of male students wearing backpacks walk through a uni campus away from the camera. their faces can't be seen

props.synopsis: Australia's top eight universities say they are "reliant" on international student fees, warning the federal government's proposed caps on foreign enrolments could damage the sector.

title.children: How dependent on international students have our universities become?

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie with sunglasses and a covid face mask

props.synopsis: Jordan Weston has been charged with serious domestic violence offences against his former partner.

title.children: Sydney police officer accused of domestic violence offences got information on alleged victim from police computer system

image.altText: Snowtown accomplice Mark Haydon in a cap and jumper.

props.synopsis: Last-minute measures to monitor and control Snowtown accomplice Mark Ray Haydon have been imposed days before the 65-year-old's sentence is set to end and he is released into the community.

title.children: Days before his sentence ends, bodies-in-the-barrels accomplice has control measures imposed

image.altText: A SA Police officer's shoulder badge.

props.synopsis: A 63-year-old woman from Adelaide's west will face court in August after being arrested over what police have described as "historical sexual offences against children".

title.children: Police arrest 63yo Adelaide woman over alleged historical child sex offences

image.altText: An insert image of Tanya Plibersek on an image of protesters with placards calling for action on climate change.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has ruled that Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek does not have to consider the environmental impacts of emissions when approving coal and gas projects.

title.children: 'Heartbroken, devastated’: Group fighting coal mine extensions dealt major blow

image.altText: An AFL player holding a football, being tackled from behind by another player.

props.synopsis: Former AFL star Sam Fisher has been jailed for more than five years after a downward spiral into drug addiction led him to become involved in an interstate trafficking scheme.

title.children: Former AFL star was 'fiercely addicted' during drug offending, judge says

image.altText: A man sits on a motorbike near citrus trees

props.synopsis: A growing number of citrus producers in Australia are being squeezed out of the industry, blaming rising production costs and low prices for their produce from supermarkets.

title.children: 'More money in budgie food': Citrus grower says he has no choice but to rip his trees out and he's not alone

image.altText: an overhead shot of a town in the desert

props.synopsis: The Real Estate Institute of Northern Territory southern region delegate says the supply of residential housing is outstripping the demand as people leave town thanks to safety concerns.

title.children: Property watchers say crime, high interest rates driving down Alice Springs house prices

image.altText: A man stands at a kitchen island, hands in pockets.

props.synopsis: A man renting from Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he was caught out by an eviction notice he says does not match the government's rhetoric on renting, and the nation's leader could have been more considerate.

title.children: Albanese's tenant says he was blindsided by eviction notice from prime minister

image.altText: Harrisdale drone shot

props.synopsis: It’s hard to argue with bill relief in a cost-of-living crisis. But this energy expert says the government's blanket power rebate for everyone could actually be counterproductive.

title.children: How just $3b saved from the power handout could have injected $15b into cheaper, cleaner energy

image.altText: ‘An absolute privilege’ Senator Fatima Payman on her politics journey so far

props.synopsis: The prime minister has labelled the words of government senator Fatima Payman not appropriate after she broke Labor ranks to accuse Israel of genocide.

title.children: Albanese labels words of government senator who broke ranks to accuse Israel of genocide 'not appropriate'

image.altText: Blue and white police tape at a crime scene.

props.synopsis: Police and prosecutors withdraw a murder charge against a 12-year-old girl over the stabbing death of a 37-year-old woman in a Footscray apartment last year.

title.children: Prosecutors withdraw murder charge against 12yo girl over stabbing death in Melbourne

image.altText: Smoke rises from two separate columns over a city dotted with low-rise homes and buildings

props.synopsis: Four people have now died in the unrest, with French officials saying a police officer died from a gunshot wound.

title.children: Police officer dies in New Caledonia riots after being shot in the head, as France declares a state of emergency
